definition: to make an appropriate and usually counterbalancing payment to
examples: compensate the victims for their loss

definition: to provide with means of counteracting variation

examples: … compensate for his feelings of loneliness by assertions of superiority.

definition: to offset an error, defect, or undesired effect
examples: his enthusiasm compensates for his lack of skill

definition: to undergo or engage in psychological or physiological compensation
examples: His aggression was an attempt to compensate for inherent passivity.
